name: thekla hue
notes:
**size**
onesize

**measurements**
circumference approx.: 46 cm / 18 inches

**materials**
version 1:
merino, copenhagen fibers:
color a: 1 skein, color 15
color b: 1 skein, color 13

version 2:
merino, copenhagen fibers:
color a: 1 skein, color 2
color b: 1 skein, color 24

version 3:
merino, copenhagen fibers:
color a: 1 skein, color 2
color b: 1 skein, color 6

circular needles 3.5 og 4 mm, 40 cm
double pointed needles 4 mm

1 stitch marker

**yarn quality**
merino, copenhagen fibers
100% wool
50 g = 108 m

**gauge**
21 sts x 31 r = 10 x 10 cm / 4 x 4 inches
in 6x6 rib stitch (k6, p6) using needles 4 mm

always use the needle size that gives you the correct gauge in both height and width, measured after washing and blocking.

**pattern information**
the thekla hat is knitted in the round from the bottom up in stripes. first, you will work 2x2 rib with stripes of 3 rounds in each color, then switch to 6x6 rib with stripes of 2 rounds in each color. at the transition between the 2x2 and 6x6 rib, you will turn your work and continue knitting in the round on what was previously the “wrong side.” be sure to change colors on the side of the work facing away from you throughout. finally, you will work decreases at the top of the hat. then block the piece to the specified measurements to smooth the edges and even out the rib pattern.
